title: Internal Control Officer Job at CasaLavoro Limited
content:
CasaLavoro Limited is a growth-oriented company dedicated to excellence, transparency, and sustainable business practices. We are currently seeking a diligent and detail-oriented Internal Control Officer to strengthen our internal processes and ensure regulatory and financial compliance across all departments.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Internal Control Officer

Job Location: 11 Yalinga Street, Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Internal Control Officer will be responsible for assessing, monitoring, and improving internal control systems.
	The ideal candidate must have 2–3 years of relevant work experience and must have previously worked in an audit firm.
	This role involves conducting risk assessments, identifying control gaps, and ensuring that operational procedures align with internal policies and regulatory standards.


Key Responsibilities


	Evaluate and test internal control systems across departments.
	Identify control gaps, recommend improvements, and monitor remediation.
	Conduct regular audits and surprise checks to ensure compliance with policies.
	Review financial transactions and processes to prevent fraud and errors.
	Document internal control findings and prepare audit reports.
	Collaborate with management to develop and update policies and procedures.
	Monitor adherence to regulatory standards and suggest necessary adjustments.
	Conduct training on internal control measures and compliance awareness.
	Investigate irregularities and escalate issues when necessary.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Finance, Business Administration, or a related field.
	2–3 years of proven work experience in internal control, internal audit, or risk management.
	Mandatory: Previous experience working in an audit firm.
	Strong understanding of accounting principles, financial reporting, and internal control frameworks.
	Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
	High level of integrity and professional ethics.
	Proficient in Microsoft Excel and accounting software (e.g., QuickBooks, Sage, etc.).
	Good communication and report-writing skills.


What We Offer


	Competitive salary package.
	Professional development and growth opportunities.
	Supportive work culture with high ethical standards.
	Exposure to cross-functional business processes.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover letter to: hr@casalavoro.net using "Internal Control Officer – Application" as the subject of the mail.

title: Sales Representative Job at Tybitx Services International Limited
content:
Tybitx Services International Limited - Our client, an integrated agro-allied processing company, is recruiting results-driven candidates to drive product sales, expand market share, and build strong relationships with distributors, retailers, and customers in the capacity below:

Job Position: Sales Representative
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The role involves ensuring product visibility and availability, identifying and recruiting distributors, monitoring sales performance and market trends, managing inventory and debtors, and resolving customer complaints promptly while meeting and exceeding sales targets.


Key Responsibilities


	Promote and sell products to existing and prospective customers.
	Identify, recruit, and maintain relationships with distributors and retailers.
	Monitor sales performance, competitor activities, and market trends.
	Ensure timely deliveries, stock rotation, and inventory accuracy.
	Handle collections and manage debtor accounts.
	Prepare and submit regular sales and inventory reports.
	Resolve customer complaints and report feedback to management.


Requirements


	Minimum of OND / HND / B.Sc in a relevant field.
	Proven sales experience in FMCG or related industry.
	Strong negotiation, presentation, and communication skills.
	Target-driven with strong relationship-building abilities.
	Knowledge of inventory and sales reporting.
	Proactive with good market analysis skills.


Salary
N100,000 / Month.

title: HVAC Project Manager Job at Tybitx Services International Limited
content:
Tybitx Services International Limited is Nigeria’s Leading HR and Management Consulting Firm. At Tybitx, we provide HR professional services rooted in Transition Management, empowering companies to achieve their goals through innovative strategies that bring incomparable results.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: HVAC Project Manager

Job Location: Obalende, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	We are seeking a results-driven and organized HVAC Project Manager for a reputable company. You will oversee end-to-end project execution, ensuring high standards of quality, safety, and client satisfaction while optimizing resources and controlling costs.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, coordinate, and supervise all aspects of assigned HVAC projects from initiation to delivery
	Develop and manage project schedules, budgets, and resources
	Oversee procurement of materials and subcontractor activities
	Provide leadership and direction to project teams and technicians
	Prepare and present regular project reports to senior management
	Ensure compliance with health and safety standards and regulatory requirements
	Maintain clear communication with clients, vendors, and internal teams to meet expectations
	Monitor project progress, identify and mitigate risks, and resolve issues promptly
	Support continuous improvement initiatives and uphold company values and quality standards


Requirements


	B.Sc or HND in Mechanical Engineering, Building Services, or a related field
	Solid knowledge of HVAC systems and installations
	Minimum 3–5 years of project management experience (preferably in the HVAC or construction industry)
	Strong leadership, team management, and negotiation skills
	Excellent communication and client-facing abilities
	Ability to work under pressure and deliver projects on schedule and within budget
	PMP certification or similar is an advantage.


Salary
N500,000 / Month (Negotiable)

title: Assistant Showroom Manager Job at Bedmate Furniture
content:
Bedmate Furniture, Nigeria's leading furniture company with a rich history spanning over two decades. Since our establishment in 2002, we have been dedicated to providing exceptional furniture solutions to homes, offices, and commercial spaces across the country.

As a socially responsible company, we strive to make a positive impact on our community and the environment. We adhere to sustainable practices, utilizing eco-friendly materials and minimizing waste in our production processes. Additionally, we actively engage in philanthropic initiatives, supporting local charities and organizations that promote education, healthcare, and social welfare. We have over 11 Showrooms all across Lagos, Abuja.
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    



We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Assistant Showroom Manager

Job Location: Wuse 2, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Summary


	The showroom manager is the direct person in charge of the showroom.
	He/She is mainy responsible for the daily sales, showroom management, product management, staff management, organizatio, motivation, training and has overall responsibility for the management of the showroom.


Responsibilties
Sales Management:


	The sales manager will be reasonably formulate monthly, weekly and daily sales plans under the leadership of the regioanal Assistant Level A, to ensure the completion of sales target.
	The sales target is determined by the sales manager. Sales manager should ask sales representatives about the specific daily sales, and resolve issues in a timely manner, and provide necessary assistance and support, to ensure sales task is completely achieved.
	Break down the monthly sales target assigned by the company into weekly and daily sales, as well as allocating daily sales tasks to each sales person, ensuring everyone has a clear sales target.
	Memorize the company's product models and regional product sales "characteristics"
	Hold daily morning meetings, convey the company sales ploicy to the sales representatives and carry out review of previous day sales.
	Prepare showroom sales statistics on a weekly basis and check whether the weekly task is completed . Note the gap,existing problems and give suggestions for improvement.
	Sort out daily forms such as commission application/refund/special offer application forms, and timely submit them to Assistant Level A.
	Execute good daily after sales management of the showroom and resolve them in time.If it cannot be resolved, report to the regional manager in time. Carry out daily showroom supervision and management(for example this will cover price tags/product hygiene/employee working conditions,etc.).
	Complete other tasks assigned by superior leaders.


Product Management:


	Carry out a good showroom product management(including new product/regular product quality feedback/showroom product retrieval/rationality of showroom product layout/store product inventory,etc.).
	Ensure regular feedback,collect information on regional competitors , and feedback information on related product.
	Regularly study and master information about new products from the company to ensure a comprehensive understanding of all products.
	Regularly check product inventory to ensure that stock is sufficient and orderly managed, avoiding stockouts or overstock and collect and analyze customer feedback on products ,report to the company headquarters in a timely manner, and provide suggestions for improvement.


Qualifications


	Interested candidates should possess an HND qualification with at least 3 years of work experience.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 monthly.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates shoud send their CV and cover letter in one document to: markalaribe9@gmail.com and copy recruitmentbedmatefurniture@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Architect Job at Bedmate Furniture Nigeria
content:
Bedmate furniture ranks as one of the best furniture company in Nigeria. Quality is our watchword is makes us rank among the very best furniture company in Nigeria. We led while other furniture company in Nigeria follows our footstep. The BEDMATE furniture company in Nigeria was founded in 2002 to offer Nigerians the very best in furniture products. Our Showrooms display Furniture ranging from Home furniture, dining set, office furniture, etc. in Lagos (Ikeja, Lekki), Abuja, and gradually expanding to other part of the country.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Architect

Job Location: Opebi, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilties
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Work together with internal management and 3rd party vendors to achieve best practices and standardization across the brands
	Manage the company’s corporate prototype designs ensuring design standards are met with an overall focus on reducing production costs
	Track assigned tasks and prioritize completion of tasks accordingly
	Create schematic layouts and elevations in CAD for new products, remodels and renovations
	Read and analyse existing blueprints, construction drawings, and plans
	Work with external partners including but not limited to Architects, Engineers, Sign Manufactures and Installers, Fixture Contractors and other applicable vendors to bid projects and assess project costs
	Support the Planning team and Project Directors with timelines, scheduling, budgeting, project documentation and project delivery
	Generate reports and checklists as directed
	Site visits for as-built measurements and field verification as required
	Carry outs task assigned by superiors.


Requirements


	Degree in Architecture, Engineering, Design, Project / Construction Management, or related field
	3 to 6 years of experience with the production of furniture/engineering drawings
	Strong ability to work in CAD software required
	3-D modelling software and/or Adobe Creative Suite experience a plus
	Proficiency in Ms Excel, Word, PowerPoint, and MS Project.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitmentbedmatefurniture@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.
